title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 3447/90 of 28 November 1990 on special conditions for the granting of private storage aid for sheepmeat and goatmeat
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION ( EEC ) No 3447/90
of 28 November 1990
on special conditions for the granting of private storage aid for sheepmeat and goatmeat
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Regulation ( EEC ) No 3446/90 shall apply subject to the provisions of this Regulation .

1 . Applications in the context of private storage aid shall be submitted to the intervention agencies listed in the Annex .
2 . In the context of a tendering procedure the period for which storage may be tendered is three months . However, the actual storage period shall be chosen by the storer . This period may extend from a minimum of three months to a maximum of seven months . However, if the storage period is greater than three months the aid shall be increased on a daily basis by ECU 1,2 per tonne per day .
The minimum quantity per contract shall be four tonnes expressed, as bone-in meat .
The security shall be ECU 120 per tonne .

This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 December 1990 .
It shall apply to private storage opened as from that date .
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States .
